title: Gumbs on Tubman at Combahee - historical context

content.question: Which of the following best describes the broader historical context of events such as the Combahee River uprising?

choices.label: Enslaved persons’ uprisings strengthened Confederate control over Southern states such as South Carolina.
The Union Army’s strategy during the Civil War was unaffected by the persistence of slavery in the South.
Both before and during the Civil War, abolitionists helped enslaved African Americans flee the South.
The increased demand for labor during the Civil War led to an improvement in conditions for enslaved people in the South.

content.answer: Both before and during the Civil War, abolitionists helped enslaved African Americans flee the South.
